subject: Re: [junit] one time setUp and tearDown
msgSnippet: ... If you need the one-time setup to be different for each suite, then don t use suite.addTestSuite. Instead, do this: { mainSuite = new TestSuite();
messageBody:
>So said Vladimir R. Bossicard on 2003-05-29 --------------------
>> public static void main(String[] args)
>> {
>> junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());
>> }
>>
>> public static Test suite()
>> {
>> TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
>>
>> suite.addTestSuite(TestLookup.class);
>> suite.addTestSuite(TestDBMaps.class);
>>
>> TestSetup wrapper = new TestSetup(suite)
>> {
>> protected void setUp()
>> {
>> oneTimeSetUp();
>> }
>>
>> protected void tearDown()
>> {
>> oneTimeTearDown();
>> }
>> };
>> return wrapper;
>> }
>
>should solve your problem

If you need the one-time setup to be different for each suite, then don't use suite.addTestSuite. Instead, do this:

{
mainSuite = new TestSuite();

dbMapsSuite = new TestSetup(new TestSuite(TestDBMaps.class)) {
// setup
// tearDown
};

mainSuite.addTest(dbMapsSuite);

//...
}
